DOC.brief_summary: The Mobile Mood Tracking App study is a small randomized trial of acceptability and usability of a mobile phone mood tracking application (mobile app) among women with depressed mood in pregnancy. The study will be assessing the perceived value and usability of this tool in pregnancy over eight weeks to test whether women using this app are more likely to receive assessments and treatments of depressed mood than women not using it.
DOC.brief_title: Mobile App for Mood in Pregnancy (Ginger iO)
DOC.criteria: Positive screening for elevated depression symptomatology (PHQ9 score must be greater than or equal to 5.) Women with pregnancies of less than 33 weeks gestation.
